page.title: 19E.ALLINGTON TABLE TENNIS
page.content: Five years ago on one of our local farms an old granary loft above a pig house was converted into a table tennis room, with space also for darts and pool. As there was little in the area for the youngsters to do in the way of organised games, the farmer invited them to join his own 3 sons and daughter for regular Friday evening "club nights". Soon a thriving sports club sprang to life with children receiving regular coaching in table tennis and, in fact a number became so proficient that they now play in the South Hams table tennis league and are doing well. The enthusiasm for table tennis spread to other locals, so that we now have a number of farmers and their friends who also participate in league table tennis.
